document.docAuthor: Nestor-Arriola, Jorge Ismael & Toledo-Hernández, Víctor Hugo
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of the dentipes group of the genus Brachiacantha (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the knowledge of the dentipes group of the genus Brachiacantha (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Brachyacantha
erythrura Mulsant 1850:530
. Crotch 1874:211 . Gorham 1894:187 . Leng 1911:302 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Brachiacantha blaisdelli
, male. a) Third ventrite. b) Dorsal habitus. c) Tegmen, concave side.

FIGURE 12.
Brachiacantha quadrillum
, male, third ventrite.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis: Elytra black without spots, but with the apical border yellow, orange or red. Cusps on the third male ventrite small. Basal lobe of male genitalia without apical hook.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 13.
Brachiacantha dentipes
, male. a) Third ventrite. b) Dorsal habitus.

FIGURE 14.
Brachiacantha subfasciata
, male, third ventrite.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female: Similar to male but pronotum almost black with only the anterolateral angles orange or yellow. Variation: The only variation registered is the sexual dimorphism.

Hosts: This species has been collected on
Phaseolus vulgaris
L.
Distribution: Mexico and Central America ( Fig. 4 ).

Discussion:
Brachiacantha erythrura
was originally described by Mulsant (1850) but was considered a variation of
B. dentipes (Fabricius)
by Gorham (1894) . Leng (1911) considered
B. erythrura
to be a valid species and placed it in his group 2; Gordon (1985) later used the groups 1 and 2 of Leng to define the
dentipes
group, but he did not include
B. erythrura
. The coloration is similar to that of some specimens of
B. quadrillum
, but the ventral cusps are larger in
B. quadrillum
and the male genitalia lack an apical hook in
B. erythrura
.
